Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

parts: This is resume of a potential tuition teacher who is applying to our private company for the role of a tutor specializing in small group and in home one-to-one tuition. Please examine the resume and come up with challenging interview questions

content.text:
TEYKAILI_resume_v5


TEY KAI LI | Email: teykaili@gmail.com | Phone: 9362 3680 

INTRODUCTION 
I am a highly motivated individual with a passion for teaching, driven by the opportunity to make a meaningful impact 
on students’ academic and personal development. I am dedicated to helping students master foundational concepts, 
as I believe this is key to tackling more complex questions. Alongside academic understanding, I focus on building 
students’ confidence and critical thinking skills, as these are essential for success beyond the classroom. 

In my teaching approach, I strive to make challenging topics accessible and engaging, fostering curiosity and a love 
for learning in students. I also believe in a dynamic, supportive learning environment tailored to meet each student’s 
unique needs, helping them reach their fullest potential. 

EDUCATION 
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore                    Aug 2020 – Jul 2023  
Bachelor of Engineering (Information Engineering and Media)  

Singapore Polytechnic                   Apr 2017 – May 2020 
Diploma in Engineering with Business 

Queenstown Secondary School                 Jan 2013 – Dec 2016 
GCE ‘O’ level 
• English, Combined Humanities (Geography, Social Studies), Additional Mathematics, Mathematics, Chemistry, 

Combine Science (Physics, Biology), Chinese 

EXPERIENCE 
Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) x Ministry of Education (MOE)           Sep 2024 – Nov 2024 
Code For Fun Enrichment Program Trainer 
• Taught the concept of computational thinking, robotics and programming, emerging technology and cyber security 

to multiple classes of 40 post-PSLE students in Primary Schools 
• Creating fun and engaging environment and lessons for them to learn, understand and apply the concepts 

Personal                                   2017 – 2023 
Part Time Private Tutor 
• One to one tuition to P6 student and peers 
• Tailored lessons that cater to the needs of each individual student/peer 
• Patiently re-explain concepts to them 

CERTIFICATES/PARTICIPATIONS 
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore                    Aug 2020 – Jul 2023  
Bachelor of Engineering (Information Engineering and Media)  
• Awarded 2nd place for IdeaJam 2021, by NTU Garage EEE 
• Awarded 1st place for HackEEEthon 1.0 by NTU EEE Club 2022  
• Video Editing of the outcome of their research for Delta-NTU corporate lab 
• Participated in Shopee Code League 2021 
• Participated in BrainHack 2021, XRperience Hackathon, by DSTA 
• Participated in Shopee Product & Design Challenge 2022 

Singapore Polytechnic                   Apr 2017 – May 2020 
Diploma in Engineering with Business 
• SP Engineering Scholarship 2017-2019 
• Shortlisted for the Young Sustainability Innovators Challenge 2018 by University of Newcastle 
• Organising Committee of SP Open House 2019 
• Organising Committee of EEE Annual Award Ceremony 2018 
• Organising Committee, Publicity and Website designer of Cogito 2018 
• Emcee of SP Freshman Orientation Programme 2019 

Queenstown Secondary School                 Jan 2013 – Dec 2016 
GCE ‘O’ level 
• Awarded Edusave Scholarship 2013, 2014, 2016 
• Awarded MOE Edusave Character Award 2014 
• Shortlisted for MOE Edusave Character Award 2013, 2015 



• Awarded EAGLES Award 2015 
• Awarded Gold Award and Best Learning Portfolio in NgeeAnn Polytechnic-BCA Design Challenge 2015 

SKILLS 
Languages: Proficient in English and Chinese 

Soft Skills: Communication, Patience, Adaptability, Empathy, Organisation, Creativity, Problem-Solving, Motivational, 
Enthusiasm, Active Listening 

Digital Skills: Microsoft Office, Zoom, AutoCAD, Java, Python, C++, Excel Visual Basic(VBA), HTML, CSS, Javascript, 
MySQL, Procreate, Filmora, Figma, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, Android Studio, Firebase, Autodesk Inventor, 
Keyshot, React, MongoDB, Robotics
content.title: TEYKAILI_resume.pdf

parts: All the files uploaded by the user have been fully loaded. Searching won't provide additional information.

Based on the resume provided, here are some challenging and insightful interview questions for assessing the candidate's suitability as a tutor specializing in small group and in-home one-to-one tuition:

### Teaching Philosophy and Approach
1. **How do you tailor your teaching strategies to accommodate students with different learning styles and needs, especially in one-to-one settings?**
2. **Can you provide an example where a student struggled with a concept, and explain how you helped them understand it effectively?**
3. **How do you handle situations where a student is unmotivated or unwilling to learn?**
4. **What methods do you use to ensure that foundational concepts are not only understood but also retained over the long term?**

### Subject-Specific and Curriculum Knowledge
5. **What are the key challenges students face in the subjects you teach, and how do you address them?**
6. **How do you ensure your lessons align with the MOE syllabus or specific school requirements?**
7. **If a student is ahead of the curriculum, how would you challenge them further without overwhelming them?**
8. **For group tuition, how do you manage varying levels of proficiency among students in the same class?**

### Experience and Practical Scenarios
9. **During your time as a trainer for the Code For Fun Enrichment Program, how did you engage a large group of 40 students and ensure effective learning for all?**
10. **How do you measure the effectiveness of your teaching, and can you share an example of how you adapted based on feedback or results?**
11. **Describe a time when a student or their parent was dissatisfied with your approach. How did you resolve the situation?**
12. **You’ve worked as a private tutor from 2017 to 2023. How has this experience shaped your teaching style and philosophy?**

### Skills and Technology
13. **You have experience with programming and emerging technologies. How would you integrate technology into your tuition sessions to make learning more engaging?**
14. **Which digital tools or platforms have you found most effective for tutoring, especially during remote learning sessions?**
15. **How would you help a student struggling to understand coding concepts such as loops or conditionals in Python?**

### Soft Skills and Behavioral Questions
16. **How do you build rapport with students and their parents to foster a supportive learning environment?**
17. **What steps do you take to manage stress and maintain enthusiasm, particularly when dealing with challenging students or situations?**
18. **If a parent insists on a teaching method that you know is ineffective, how would you handle the conversation?**

### Career Motivation and Goals
19. **What inspired you to pursue teaching alongside your engineering background?**
20. **Where do you see yourself in five years as an educator, and how does this role align with your long-term goals?**

These questions are designed to assess the candidate's teaching philosophy, adaptability, problem-solving skills, subject-matter expertise, and ability to work with both students and parents effectively.
